comment: She seems like a nice person and wants to help. She is a very hard grader when it comes to the project and discussions. You have to do 13 discussions but she only grades 10 she randomly chooses. The Project is a lot of work and and not very clear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Pierquet is professional, probably been a professor quite a while and worked with several companies---I don't know her background well enough. However, the group project she has throughout the whole class is highly unorganized, very confusing, and lots of questions for each section left unanswered.

Let me start by saying I had a rough time in this class. There is a ton of work and she is an extremely tough grader. That being said, if you communicate with her and do your work she will help you out. The group project was a nightmare and your group will determine whether you get a good or bad grade.

She's a great professor & gives phenomenal feedback. I actually sort of feel like I could be pals with her in real life. However, the course requires a lot of work and a lot of time. The quizzes require a lot of prep, the discussions are very involved, and the project is massive. If you don't have a TON of time, don't take this course with her.

It is nearly impossible to get in contact with her. I got an A+ on all of her tests from reading the book but any open-ended work she grades, she grades unnecessarily hard. My group project team had a zoom meeting scheduled with her and she arrived an hour late. She does not care about her students. I would avoid this class at all costs.

Seems decent but is a petty grader. This class is not hard, but her feedback never makes sense on writing assignments. Discussions should be an easy 100, but the feedback is rarely specific. There is a group paper, so if you take her, you better be asking for feedback consistently & avoid procrastinating. Work with your group to get a good grade

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!! She is extremely harsh on her grading and her assignment requirements and criteria are disorganized. You can spend hours on the group project, meet countless times, and put your best effort into it and all you will get out of it is a failing grade. She is not even gracious enough to give an even 70%. Terrible professor
Assigns way too much work for sports marketing. Really hard grader and very hard quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: For this sports marketing class we did a project on dressage... thats fancy horse riding- not even horse racing... She is an unbelievably tough grader and can be pretty harsh in the way she responds to you. She cares about this material and wants you to too: but this was an elective... she needed to chill 100% of the time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: don't do it! the reason I have be in school for another semester, could've been graduating but it is what it is. if it wasn't for that damn group project. she grades really hard. I could write a whole essay and go into detail but I been writing all semester so I'm just going to give a lil warning and say, do not do it if you have the choice.

Literally avoid at all cost. I did not pass a single quiz all semester. Webcam quizzes that always had mistakes that she did not change. Never made above a 75 on discussions. Group project is so tedious and difficult. My group was not good so that did not help. Very harsh grader. I never imagined this class would be this hard!! GET READy 2 READ!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She is very cold and does not want to help students. She grades extremely harshly and will critique every little thing. Exams are recorded through the camera and are very difficult.

She handled the transition from f2f to online much better than most. You can text her at 11pm & she'll probably help you out. HOWEVER her instructions are very vague. You have to be willing to put in graduate level work and kiss up a lot to win a good grade in her class. This was the hardest class I've ever taken. PLEASE don't make the same mistake
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Probably one of the worst and rudest profs I've taken. Ive never given a review before but this bad experience was enough for me to give one on her. She does not accommodate so don't bother asking for a second chance. Really tough grader so if you can't afford to jeopardize your grades/gpa then DO NOT TAKE HER!

Professor Pierquet is willing to help you whenever you need it. She is very sweet but is also a tough grader! I never got a 100 on any of my DB. The final group project was tedious, but if you have a good group you will do fine. Her exams are HARD. I had a tough time. you must know the material, you cant memorize it. Read the book! Take notes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Class does not translate well into an online. So much reading - if that is not your learning style, too bad. The book was horrible, her review notes tedious and the tests were ridiculously detailed. It doesn't matter if you understand the concepts - you need to be able to memorize. Semester-long group project is 30% of the grade which is crazy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Very nice lady, but very unclear on what she wants to be done. Work load is substantial with little remorse for grading. Very Unorganized, I mean she would assign topics that she didn't even go over. She taught very little and when asked particular questions her response was to look in the book or see what the book says, which is very concerning...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I took her for sports marketing online and was dumbfounded to find that we had a group project in which we had to set up an event for a local sports team. Having team members that weren't close by made things incredibly difficult, along with her constant deadlines for items that took longer to complete. This class made me start drinking again.

HORRID PROFESSOR!!! THIS IS AN INTRO CLASS! She was the WORST professor I have had in the 4 years I have been at this school. Group project, all semester long, worth MOST of your grade and she uses examples with SPELLING ERRORS... She is delusional, rude, unhelpful, and psychotic! She gives you feedback when asked but then will BOMB you still

This was the most labor intensive class I've taken at KSU. Quizzes 2x a week, discussion boards, exams that were impossible and a massive group project that was with an online class making it impossible to coordinate with students. Forget about emailing her she doesnt respond until a week after if you're lucky.

This is quite literally the worst professor I've ever had the displeasure of taking. The majority of your grade is determined by a group project with absolutely no direction given. This teacher truly doesn't care about your education as she seemingly gets satisfaction from being an extremely tough grader. Took this ELECTIVE for fun and I regret it.

I took sports marketing online because it was something I was really interested in until I got this professor. There is a HUGE group project that requires the group to host a LOCAL event that the professor show up to. By the way I was the only member in my group that lived in GA which lead to me doing the project by myself.

If you are taking her online I would suggest dropping the class immediately. She grades very heavily on a group project and she is so specific with the guidelines to it, she makes you come up with 10 sponsors and raise money for the project which is so extra for an online class. She wont allow late assignments even if its your group members fault
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I would highly avoid taking any class of hers. I have been through two of her classes both in class and online (not by choice). Your entire grade is based off of group projects and she is highly selective and picky about what work is acceptable. Along with a ridiculous amount of workload that hardly even counts for anything.

This professor is RIDICULOUS. Who does LARGE group projects for ONLINE CLASSES??? She grades ridiculously hard and all of the directions are vague and unclear. Almost everyone failed the first test and she refused to do anything about it to help us. Quizzes are only open for ONE day. She uses lockdown browser+webcam for tests! HORRIBLE!!!

By far the worst teacher I've had to date, quizzes are taken before lectures which makes no sense.(Also get 15 minutes for 20+ questions)Unclear grading criteria, gives you an example of a "C" paper, which is actually an F if you do what she's asked. Be prepared to teach yourself. This class single handily made me change my major from marketing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took this professor for MKTG 4650 & 4870 and she was AMAZING! For 4650 there were 4 exams and either a blog or discussion and a quiz due every week. One major group project for both classes. 4870 they had a quiz and disussion due every week only 1 exam. She cares about her students and their grades. Rarely opened the book and got an A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: DON'T TAKE THIS TEACHER! There's so much work and everything is due on a different day. Tests are due on Mon., peer review on Tues., discussion posts on Wed., quizzes on Thurs. and more. She grades tough and is highly disorganized and unclear. Tests are 75 questions in 115 minutes. The project is insane and she doesn't respond to emails timely!

WAY TOO MUCH WORK ( 21 quizzes, 4 exams, 6 blog post, 5 discussion post, and one huge project. You will be overly busy every week. D2L instructions not very clear. Ten question quizzes on avg. of 35 pages of reading; 70 question exams over average of 140 pages of reading w/ no key area study guide. DON"T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This class was literally HORRIBLE. DO NOT TAKE HER!!! She expects graduate level work and time for an undergrad class that should not require the amount of stress that this class did. She knows a lot, but is really unclear on what she wants from you. It was a horrible experience.

Informative class but the professor makes it frustrating. She tries to make 3 of her classes work together on a project. Makes no effort in trying to understand and use D2L to assist students. Need to read the book to do online quizzes that are due basically every other day.

I would not recommend this class to anyone! She is VERY unclear with her directions, and if you email her with questions get ready to wait days to hear back. By far the worst professor I have ever had. I never really knew what she wanted out of assignments. Don't take her if you have any other option. I got a B but I had to work really hard for it.

Really nice lady, but not the best professor. The group project is a nightmare, so hope that you're assigned to a good group. She expects a lot from you. There are 4 tests and weekly quizzes and discussions. It is a ton of work every week. A TON. Easy to get in touch with and she loves her job. BUY THE BOOK. Take her classes with caution.

I recommend choosing a different teacher for this course.  I took this class over summer semester and not only does she expect a lot (3 group projects, 10 minutes for 10 heavy reading question quizzes), she also grades on timeliness.  She seems to teach like people don't take other classes simultaneously or have other obligations (such as jobs).

She teaches this class like this is the only one you are taking. I took her this summer and it was the worst decision ever. The group project is insane for the amount of work, the tests are 75 mins, 50 questions AND 2 essays. I took an 8 week course and in that we had 5 exams, 5 DQ, 18 quizzes, 3 part group project, and other things along the way.

The absolute worst teacher, I have ever had.  She is unorganized, holds students to expectations she doesn't foll.  Gives 15 question test with only 10 minutes.  Unclear expectations are start date of discussion and expects to answer discussion before reading the book. She is also not open to feedback and gets defensive. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS!!!!!!!

Please do not take this course with this professor. She is very unorganized and will throw all work on you at the very end of the semester. The entire class was surrounded around a Brain Lab activity verses learning how to advertise. Oh yea, she is always right...you're always wrong!

She expects alot from her students-expecting them to be adults and do the work that is assigned. Considering the volume of material to be covered she did a great job. I enjoyed the current examples she had in class. If you talk to her, you understand she does care and will help you succeed in class.

I am a good student and have been at two different colleges. She is by far the worst teacher I have ever taken. What she has to say in class does not even relate to the tests. She doesn't know how to manage people or communicate topics. Not a very tough class, but she makes you not want to attend. I would not advise taking her class.

A ton of busy work. The group project was ridiculous, but I heard that if you schedule an appointment with her for help she will explain everything you need to do. Make friends with her and participate and you should do fine. You have 5 minutes to take a 10MC quiz every week online and she started doing open book tests towards the end.

She was literally the worst teacher I have ever had. She didn't teach us anything and just gave us busy work. The group project was all semester and we worked really hard on it and barely got a C. The tests were ridiculously hard especially since she didn't teach us anything. Also, she was extremely unorganized. ABSOLUTELY DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!!!!

The group project is ridiculously hard and you learn nothing all semester except how to make stuff up. She grades all assignments really hard and it's impossible to keep up w/ her system and ignorance on D2L. Worst of all, she's rude and runs her class like a drill sergeant. If you take her class prepare to drown in busy work.

This professor was one of the worst I ever had. Expectations were not clear. Class time is devoted to reading articles out of the Wall Street Journal. The test were impossible, 1st test, literally the entire class failed. Test are administered in class on Vista and are extremely difficult. Group project is also intense.Save your money!!!
